verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to Ariel<WH740>, to Ariel<WH740>, the city<WH7151> where David<WH1732> dwelt<WH2583>! add<WH5595> ye year<WH8141> to year<WH8141>; let them kill<WH5362> sacrifices<WH2282>.
Yet I will distress<WH6693> Ariel<WH740>, and there shall be heaviness<WH8386> and sorrow<WH592>: and it shall be unto me as Ariel<WH740>.
And I will camp<WH2583> against thee round about<WH1754>, and will lay siege<WH6696> against thee with a mount<WH4674>, and I will raise<WH6965> forts<WH4694> against thee.

And thou shalt be brought down<WH8213>, and shalt speak<WH1696> out of the ground<WH776>, and thy speech<WH565> shall be low<WH7817> out of the dust<WH6083>, and thy voice<WH6963> shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit<WH178>, out of the ground<WH776>, and thy speech<WH565> shall whisper<WH6850> out of the dust<WH6083>.

Moreover the multitude<WH1995> of thy strangers<WH2114> shall be like small<WH1851> dust<WH80>, and the multitude<WH1995> of the terrible ones<WH6184> shall be as chaff<WH4671> that passeth away<WH5674>: yea, it shall be at an instant<WH6621> suddenly<WH6597>.

Thou shalt be visited<WH6485> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> with thunder<WH7482>, and with earthquake<WH7494>, and great<WH1419> noise<WH6963>, with storm<WH5492> and tempest<WH5591>, and the flame<WH3851> of devouring<WH398> fire<WH784>.

¶ And the multitude<WH1995> of all the nations<WH1471> that fight<WH6633> against Ariel<WH740>, even all that fight<WH6638> against her and her munition<WH4685>, and that distress<WH6693> her, shall be as a dream<WH2472> of a night<WH3915> vision<WH2377>.

It shall even be as when an hungry<WH7457> man dreameth<WH2492>, and, behold, he eateth<WH398>; but he awaketh<WH6974>, and his soul<WH5315> is empty<WH7386>: or as when<WH834> a thirsty man<WH6771> dreameth<WH2492>, and, behold, he drinketh<WH8354>; but he awaketh<WH6974>, and, behold, he is faint<WH5889>, and his soul<WH5315> hath appetite<WH8264>: so shall the multitude<WH1995> of all the nations<WH1471> be, that fight<WH6633> against mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726>.
¶ Stay<WH4102> yourselves, and wonder<WH8539>; cry ye out<WH8173>, and cry<WH8173>: they are drunken<WH7937>, but not with wine<WH3196>; they stagger<WH5128>, but not with strong drink<WH7941>.

For the LORD<WH3068> hath poured out<WH5258> upon you the spirit<WH7307> of deep sleep<WH8639>, and hath closed<WH6105> your eyes<WH5869>: the prophets<WH5030> and your rulers<WH7218>, the seers<WH2374> hath he covered<WH3680>.

And the vision<WH2380> of all is become unto you as the words<WH1697> of a book<WH5612> that is sealed<WH2856>, which men deliver<WH5414> to one that is learned<WH3045>, saying<WH559>, Read<WH7121> this, I pray thee: and he saith<WH559>, I cannot<WH3201>; for it is sealed<WH2856>:
And the book<WH5612> is delivered<WH5414> to him that is not learned<WH3045><WH5612>, saying<WH559>, Read<WH7121> this, I pray thee: and he saith<WH559>, I am not learned<WH3045>.

¶ Wherefore the Lord<WH136> said<WH559>, Forasmuch<WH3282> as this people<WH5971> draw near<WH5066> me with their mouth<WH6310>, and with their lips<WH8193> do honour<WH3513> me, but have removed<WH7368> their heart<WH3820> far<WH7368> from me, and their fear<WH3374> toward me is taught<WH3925> by the precept<WH4687> of men<WH582>:

Therefore, behold, I will proceed<WH3254> to do a marvellous work<WH6381> among this people<WH5971>, even a marvellous work<WH6381> and a wonder<WH6382>: for the wisdom<WH2451> of their wise<WH2450> men shall perish<WH6>, and the understanding<WH998> of their prudent<WH995> men shall be hid<WH5641>.

Woe<WH1945> unto them that seek deep<WH6009> to hide<WH5641> their counsel<WH6098> from the LORD<WH3068>, and their works<WH4639> are in the dark<WH4285>, and they say<WH559>, Who seeth<WH7200> us? and who knoweth<WH3045> us?

Surely your turning of things upside down<WH2017> shall be esteemed<WH2803> as the potter's<WH3335> clay<WH2563>: for shall the work<WH4639> say<WH559> of him that made<WH6213> it, He made<WH6213> me not? or shall the thing framed<WH3336> say<WH559> of him that framed<WH3335> it, He had no understanding<WH995>?

Is it not yet a very<WH4213> little while<WH4592>, and Lebanon<WH3844> shall be turned<WH7725> into a fruitful field<WH3759>, and the fruitful field<WH3759> shall be esteemed<WH2803> as a forest<WH3293>?

¶ And in that day<WH3117> shall the deaf<WH2795> hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of the book<WH5612>, and the eyes<WH5869> of the blind<WH5787> shall see<WH7200> out of obscurity<WH652>, and out of darkness<WH2822>.
The meek<WH6035> also shall increase<WH3254> their joy<WH8057> in the LORD<WH3068>, and the poor<WH34> among men<WH120> shall rejoice<WH1523> in the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.
For the terrible one<WH6184> is brought to nought<WH656>, and the scorner<WH3887> is consumed<WH3615>, and all that watch<WH8245> for iniquity<WH205> are cut off<WH3772>:

That make a man<WH120> an offender<WH2398> for a word<WH1697>, and lay a snare<WH6983> for him that reproveth<WH3198> in the gate<WH8179>, and turn aside<WH5186> the just<WH6662> for a thing of nought<WH8414>.

Therefore thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, who redeemed<WH6299> Abraham<WH85>, concerning the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290>, Jacob<WH3290> shall not now be ashamed<WH954>, neither shall his face<WH6440> now wax pale<WH2357>.

But when he seeth<WH7200> his children<WH3206>, the work<WH4639> of mine hands<WH3027>, in the midst<WH7130> of him, they shall sanctify<WH6942> my name<WH8034>, and sanctify<WH6942> the Holy One<WH6918> of Jacob<WH3290>, and shall fear<WH6206> the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.
They also that erred<WH8582> in spirit<WH7307> shall come<WH3045> to understanding<WH998>, and they that murmured<WH7279> shall learn<WH3925> doctrine<WH3948>.
